infonodes.name: Mercury
infonodes.info: Mercury is the smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System. Its orbital period around the Sun is 87.97 days.

infonodes.name: Venus
infonodes.info: Venus is the second planet from the Sun. Its orbital period around the Sun is 224.7 days, it is the longest rotation period of any planet in the Solar System.

infonodes.name: Earth
infonodes.info: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only object in the Universe known to harbor life. Its orbital period around the Sun is 365.26 days.

infonodes.name: Mars
infonodes.info: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System after Mercury. Its orbital period around the Sun is 687 days.

infonodes.name: Jupiter
infonodes.info: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System. Its orbital period around the Sun is 12 years.

infonodes.name: Saturn
infonodes.info: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter. Its orbital period around the Sun is 29 years.

infonodes.name: Uranus
infonodes.info: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. Its orbital period around the Sun is 84 years.

infonodes.name: Neptune
infonodes.info: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun in the Solar System. Its orbital period around the Sun is 165 years.
